resources.string: A different password for each site. \nNo passwords stored.
One password to rule them all
You just have to remember a master key. Using it, a different password is generated for each website.
It\'s safer than a password store
Passwords are never stored, so they can\'t be stolen. They are generated each time using a secure encryption algorithm.
Your passwords are generated using also a private key, which is stored in the device. An attacker would need both your master and private keys to generate your passwords.
Use it in every facet of your life
You can define multiple profiles. For example, a personal profile and a work profile, which you can share with your co-workers. Each profile has its own private key and settings.
Some websites have specific requirements, like an specific password length. No problem! You can specify different settings for those websites, and Hash my pass will remember them.
When using your favourite browser, share the page with Hash my Pass. You\'ll generate the website password in the blink of an eye.
First of all, we\'ll create your first profile and a private key. I have taken the liberty to generate a random one for you, but you can use a different one if you prefer.
You don\'t have to remember this key, just make sure that you don\'t lose it! You have to choose and remember a master key too, but you don\'t have to fill it out right now.

Version 1.0.0 beta1

Hash my pass is an application that makes it easier to generate secure and different passwords for each website.

Hash my pass is based on the password generation mechanism of Password Hasher by Steve Cooper and Password Hasher Plus by Eric Woodruff.

Hash my pass is compatible with the Google Chrome Password Hasher Plus extension by Eric Woodruff.
